item.title: 8 Most Satisfying Platinum Trophies To Earn
item.description:
Summary

  • Devil May Cry 5 platinum takes real effort, balancing attack & accuracy on tough missions.
  • Red Dead Redemption 2 platinum requires mastery of entire storyline, side plots, and online challenges.
  • Returnal offers a satisfying platinum from deep themes and unpredictable procedurally generated gameplay.

There’s something special about hearing the sound of the trophy when players have conquered a game after many hours. While it’s easy to get some platinum trophies, others can only be earned by putting in serious effort, preparing good tactics, and never giving up. Many players focus less on finishing the game and more on the process, grind, and pride they feel after finally getting the last trophy.

Here are eight platinum trophies that are memorable because they require significant effort and reward players with satisfaction once they finish them. By taking on grueling fights, getting sucked into gripping stories, or sinking plenty of time into connected gameplay, each of these games provides some of the most rewarding trophies for PlayStation gamers.

1 Devil May Cry 5

Platinum Trophy: "Worthy Of Legend"

Devil May Cry 5
10 /10
13
8.8 /10
Released
March 8, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Capcom
Publisher(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC, PS5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

True to the DMC series, getting Devil May Cry 5 platinum takes some real effort. In the game, players work through numerous missions on several difficulty settings, including the super-tough Hell and Hell mode, where there is only one chance to survive and enemies can easily kill players who aren't careful. The points earned for style, rank, and skill in fighting enemies all influence each mission, so players have to carefully balance attack and accuracy.

The enjoyment of this game comes from learning and mastering every character’s fighting techniques. Players will have put every skill they have to the test by the time the achievement is unlocked. People don’t just receive this trophy — they have to grind, be great at what they do, and stay dedicated to the work.

2 Red Dead Redemption 2

Platinum Trophy: "Legend Of The West"

Red Dead Redemption 2
10 /10
153
9.5 /10
Released
October 26, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Rockstar Games
Publisher(s)
Rockstar Games
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC, Stadia
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

With an enormous world to explore, Red Dead Redemption 2 ’s trophy list is just as impressive. Getting the platinum demonstrates mastery of every aspect of Arthur Morgan’s adventure, including exploration, challenges, forming many positive relationships, and learning the whole storyline and its side plots. The game also has a significant number of online trophies, and as many gamers know by now, online trophies in a story-centric game are never an easy job. It takes time, effort, and commitment, but with a satisfying payoff.

Players who are especially fond of open-world games and want to experience every part of the game might feel they have truly finished here. The game’s difficulty does not always matter or make a platinum trophy worth chasing; sometimes, what counts is how big the world is, how much time it takes to master, and when the player's journey is over. There’s a sense of achievement when players are sure every horse, duel, and side quest is recorded in their completed log.

3 Call Of Duty: Modern Warfare Remastered

Platinum Trophy: "Just Another Day At The Office"

6 Images
6 Images
Call of Duty: Modern Warfare Remastered
8 /10
8.5 /10
Released
November 4, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Raven Software, Beenox
Publisher(s)
Activision
Platform(s)
PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PC, Steam
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

If the original Modern Warfare was famous for anything (besides how amazing it was), it would be its insane difficulty spike in Veteran difficulty mode. Even though, at first glance, this trophy list might look ordinary, any seasoned COD player understands that playing on Veteran in Modern Warfare Remastered is really something else entirely. If players add the Mile High Club mission, with its tough time limit, getting this platinum is something every Call of Dut y fan will remember forever.

It is not only nostalgia that makes it enjoyable; mastering this notable shooter feels great. Players need to be prepared at all times, since the game moves from close fights to thrilling explosions in a matter of seconds. It reminds players of the harder shooter games of earlier days, as winning was truly a reward.

4 Alien: Isolation

Platinum Trophy: "Alien: Isolation"

Alien: Isolation
6 /10
27
9.6 /10
Released
October 7, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Creative Assembly
Publisher(s)
Sega
Platform(s)
PS4, PS3, Xbox One, Xbox 360, Switch, PC, Android, iOS
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Alien: Isolation is already a nerve-wracking game, but to get the platinum, players must deal with the Xenomorph in very tense situations. Sneaking, managing the game’s scant resources, and having an understanding of advanced AI are important skills to master. Setting the rules like no deaths, not using some tools, and completing side tasks without help makes the game harder than it normally is, but that does not necessarily mean it's too hard or not fun. It makes the players feel more immersed and actually connected to the game, which makes it all the while more fun to try and achieve its platinum trophy.

Being completely involved is one of the main reasons this trophy is so rewarding for players. Every trophy players get makes it seem like they have surpassed another tough challenge, and when players finish, they know that they have really overcome one of the smartest enemies in gaming. Each fearful moment and wave of suspense is absolutely worth experiencing in this game.

5 Overwatch/Overwatch 2

Platinum Trophy: "Overwatch Platinum Trophy"

Overwatch 2
6 /10
59
7.4 /10
Released
August 10, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Blizzard
Publisher(s)
Blizzard
Platform(s)
PS4, PS5, Xbox One, Switch, Xbox One S, Xbox One X, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

When it comes to multiplayer games, Overwatch’s challenges are so varied that it takes adaptability and a good set of skills to complete them all. To succeed, players should know how to play different heroes, complete special tasks with each one, and participate regularly in competitive games. Because there is no regular campaign, getting every trophy means facing opponents in real-time online matches.

Platinum feels rewarding since players achieve it by playing against other people, where there are no easy wins or painless losses — and there will be some painful losses, that's for sure. The game encourages players to adapt to their team, be aware of their surroundings, and build skills at many different styles of playing. Being able to say they take part in competitive shooters is truly worthy of recognition, especially for those who manage to outshine the rest.

6 The Evil Within

Platinum Trophy: "Pure Evil"

The Evil Within
5 /10
7.8 /10
Released
October 14, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Tango Gameworks
Publisher(s)
Bethesda
Platform(s)
Xbox One, Xbox 360, PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

The Evil Within is a game that is unafraid to take players through a harrowing experience. Because of its psychological horror, lack of supplies, and tough fighting, just finishing the game becomes a huge challenge. To get the platinum, players need to play through AKUMU mode, where one wrong move leads to starting all over again — and not to mention, the enemies are much more aggressive than they already were. It’s hard to stay calm while also remaining composed enough to not die, but oh boy, is it satisfying once players get the hang of the game and hear that satisfying platinum ding.

This platinum demonstrates the dedication and suffering of masochistic players. Players are put in a helpless situation, required to memorize patterns of enemies and cope with heavy stress throughout the game. The perk isn’t limited to the trophy; it also brings a rush of triumph after players escape from the game.

7 The Last Of Us (PS3)

Platinum Trophy: "It Can't Be For Nothing"

The Last of Us
10 /10
21
9.8 /10
Released
June 14, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Naughty Dog
Publisher(s)
Sony
Platform(s)
PS3, PS4
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

The Last of Us on PS3 was a revolutionary game, and its platinum add-on was just as much of a breakthrough. Besides trying to make it through the game’s events, players had to deal with extremely hard settings, search for hidden collectibles, and commit to the challenging multiplayer components.

How much satisfaction a player gets out of a platinum is determined mostly by how much they care about the game’s story and gameplay. When people complete the game, they complete an unforgettable story where every goal has been met, and The Last of Us managed to hit all those points perfectly. And, due to how much time, skill, and passion it takes, this game ranks as one of the best accomplishments on the PlayStation 3.

8 Returnal

Platinum Trophy: "Helios"

5 Images
5 Images
Returnal
10 /10
8.9 /10
Released
April 30, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Housemarque
Publisher(s)
Sony
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Besides being a killer roguelike, Returnal explores deep psychological themes and mixes them with rapid-fire bullet hell battles in an alien setting. Getting the highest achievement means facing varied stages, tough challenges, and exploring all the randomly arranged biomes completely. To win, a player must repeat actions accurately, handle their tools and resources carefully, and visit every part of the story to understand the whole situation.

What makes this platinum satisfying is that it’s hard to predict as the game is procedurally generated (apart from a few pre-determined set pieces), but for the most part, each and every single run is completely different. This means trying to find a specific audio log could either take players an hour or a dozen, which is painful, but that's the beauty of it; it's all the more satisfying once players complete it. Each run introduces different risks and different potential rewards. Once the final trophy is earned, it reveals that the player was able to conquer the game’s notorious challenges. The genre rewards skill, memory, and strength, but most of all, it rewards perseverance.

item.title: How to Install the Best PEAK Mods
item.description:
The indie co-op climbing simulator PEAK has suddenly become extremely popular. Despite the simplicity of the idea, the game offers a very diverse experience, especially considering the daily map updates. You can make climbing the mountain even more fun by adding mods , so in this guide, we will tell you how to install the best mods for PEAK .

Mods can add new features to your game, as well as improve existing ones. For example, you can make it easier to use a backpack, but first, you will need to install a special application.

How to Install Mods in PEAK

Like most popular games, PEAK quickly became a target for mod creators. While there aren't many mods available at the time of writing, most of them are very useful or at least bring a new kind of fun to the table. Even better, they couldn't be easier to use.

Players have a few options for installing mods in PEAK , including manual installation or using the Thunderstore Mod Manager. Of course, the second method is much easier, so we recommend using it.

How to Install Mods in PEAK via the Thunderstore Mod Manager

  1. First, you need to download and install the Thunderstore Mod Manager.
  2. Launch the application and find PEAK , then create an account for modding.
  3. Next, you need to install BepInExPack PEAK, which can also be done using the Mod Manager.
  4. After that, install the desired mods using the Mod Manager.
  5. Finally, launch your modded version of the game.

How to Install Mods Manually in PEAK

  1. For this method, you also need to download BepInExPack PEAK and unpack it into the game directory.
  2. Next, launch and close PEAK .
  3. After that, download the desired mods and place them in the Plugins folder found inside the BepInEx folder that you placed in the game directory.
  4. Then, all you have to do is launch the game.

It is worth noting that some mods only need to be installed by the host, so read each mod's descriptions carefully.

The Best Mods in PEAK

Now that you know how to install mods, you'll be on the hunt for some really worthwhile options. To make your life easier, below we have collected a few mods that every PEAK climber should try out:

  • EasyBackpack - An extremely useful mod that makes it easier to use a backpack. You no longer have to take it off every time you want to put something in it.
  • PEAK Unlimited - If you want to play PEAK with more than 3 friends at the same time, then this mod is what you need. Although this mod allows you to add up to 20 people at a time, you should still play with a smaller number so that the game does not crash.
  • ReviveHotkey - This mod adds the ability to revive your character when unconscious to the game. It's a simple change that makes life a lot easier when playing.
5 Images
5 Images

item.title: Red Blade Ghost Mech Boss Guide – Death Stranding 2: On the Beach
item.description:
In Death Stranding 2: On the Beach 's Order 22, Sam is tasked with looking for Tomorrow after she mysteriously leaves the DHV Magellan. While looking for her, you'll encounter the Blade Ghost Mech enemy type for the first time, and be presented with something of a mini-boss fight. This is the first time Sam will encounter these heavily armored red mechs, and they present a significant increase in difficulty over the mechs Sam had encountered up to this point. In this guide, we'll show you how to defeat Blade Ghost Mechs in Death Stranding 2 , not only in this encounter, but for the remainder of the game.

How to Kill the Red Blade Ghost Mechs in Death Stranding 2

Things Get Tough:

If you're like us, when you first encountered the Blade Ghost Mechs at the end of Order 22, you were immediately wiped out. Playing on DS2 's Brutal difficulty level, the first attack – a twirling blade attack – killed Sam in one go. Even when playing at lower difficulty levels, this enemy is far tougher than any other enemy found in the game up to this point. However, after dying repeatedly, we learned some tricks that will help you get through the fight.

Technically, there are at least two locations where the Blade Ghost Mechs appear while looking for Tomorrow. After crossing the first ladder Tomorrow places over a river, you'll see a group of 3 mechs hovering off the ground to the left. You do not have to engage this group. If you want, you can keep following Tomorrow's footsteps until you reach her jacket. Once you reach the jacket, you'll have no choice but to engage the mechs.

Preparation:

First, it's important to prepare yourself for the full fight, which consists of two groups of three mechs. Once you defeat the first group, three more will rise from the tar. With this in mind, you want to make sure you bring enough ammo to deal with all six mechs. Consider the following loadout:

  • Machine Gun – you want something with a large clip. These mechs have a shield system that you must wear down before you do any real damage. Low-level assault rifles require reloading at a rate which isn't great for this fight. You'll make some progress on the shield, but by the time you reload, you will have the other mechs attacking you. You will have brief windows to attack. Make sure you have a large enough clip to maintain and break the shield.
  • Shotgun – If you feel extremely confident in your aiming, the Shotgun is a viable option. However, you need to make each shot count. The damage, especially at Lv2, really helps. Make sure to add extra ammo to your backpack if you take this route.
  • Grenade Pistol – the Grenade Pistol is the secret weapon for this fight. Despite its low overall ammo count, the benefits are extremely useful. First, they do major damage to the shield, but more importantly, they will send the mechs flying to the ground, giving you a brief window to attack one of the other two mechs.
  • Backpack - Extra ammo is the best thing you can out on the backpack for this fight. If you struggle with dodging the mech's attack, and are constantly taking damage, you may want to add a Utility Pouch if you've unlocked it, or carry extra Blood Packs.
  • Battle Skelton – The extra boost and protection offered is helpful here. The Boost Skeleton is also a viable option, if you prefer an increase in speed.
  • APAS Enhancements : Improved MP Bullets (40), Aim Assistance (80), Proximity Alarm (40), Skeleton Auto-Assist (40).

Hits from the Blade Ghost Mechs are incredibly damaging, so you may want to take the time to collect a good amount of Cryptobiotes before entering the fight. The Blood Bag system helps, but using Cryptobiotes is much faster.

Defeat the Blade Ghost Mechs:

In this fight, the name of the game is evasion. Dodging attacks in DS2 takes a bit of practice, which is a major part of why this fight can be so challenging. Every attack can be dodged. It's simply about getting the timing down. Generally speaking, you want to dodge just before an attack hits you. With some attacks, if you evade at the right moment, the Odradek will engage, and physically block the enemy's blade.

The Blade Ghost Mech features a shield system that is color coded. As you attack, the shield will begin to weaken, and change colors as it does so. It will go from blue, to orange, then to red. Finally, it will break, leaving the mech vulnerable to attack. Take advantage of this moment to deal as much damage as possible.

The Blade Ghost Mech will use several attacks, but keep an eye out for these attacks specifically:

  • Wind-Up : The mech has two wind-up attacks that are incredibly dangerous. The first is likely the most damaging attack the Blade Ghost Mech uses. It will slightly twist its body, then begin to spin in a circle with both blades outstretched. If Sam gets caught in this, he can be taken out in one attack. The second wind-up attack is a sprint-to-lunge attack. You can tell the difference by the height of the blade when the wind-up occurs. For the lunge, the blade will be much higher over the mech's head.
  • Ranged Blade Throw: While focusing on one mech, keep a look-out for blades being thrown at you from off-screen. This can happen suddenly, and cause serious damage if it hits Sam. You'll get a slight red flash when this happens, so watch for that as well.
  • Leaping Plunge : The mechs will bow low, then leap into the air, flip, then plunge both blades into the ground. Wait until just before the blades hit the ground to dodge. If you evade too early, the mechs seem to recover faster, then attack while Sam is getting up.

These are the three special attacks we witnessed during this fight. Use these strategies the best you can. It may take a few attempts, but you'll get there.

24 Images

Death Stranding 2: On the Beach

item.title: Rematch Launches Exciting Cosmetics Collaboration With Famous Athletics Brand
item.description:
Rematch , developed by independent video game studio Sloclap, has officially rolled out its first branded cosmetics collab, teaming up with global sportswear heavyweight Puma. It’s a big moment for the recently released Rematch , as it introduces a new level of immersive customization to its high-energy, arcade-style soccer experience.

After launching on June 19, Rematch saw a strong start, as over 92,000 concurrent players joined in on Steam during the first day. The early momentum largely comes from the way it changes the traditional formula. There are no fouls, offsides, throw-ins, or goal kicks. Instead, each match takes place in a closed arena where the ball stays in motion from start to finish. That constant movement keeps the game flowing, with the focus entirely on dribbling, positioning, and scoring under pressure.

On June 27, the game announced its collaboration with Puma, a company known for its presence in both football and streetwear. As part of the collaboration, the online multiplayer football game Rematch added its first fully branded cosmetic pack, with players now able to wear Puma jerseys, shorts, shin guards, and boots during matches. The items follow Puma’s recognizable design, and the boots and guards come from the Puma Future line - a performance-oriented series built for actual football play. Rematch has also confirmed this is just the beginning, noting that more content tied to the Puma collaboration is in development, stating “there's more to come.”

Rematch x Puma Collaboration Now Live

In a press release, Félix Garczynski, Head of Marketing & Publishing at Sloclap, described the collaboration with Puma as a strong fit, explaining that Rematch was designed to capture “the full energy, the style, the competition and self-expression,” and called Puma “a perfect partner” thanks to its presence in both gaming and football. Ivan Dashkov, Puma’s Director of Emerging Marketing Technology, added that “football is part of Puma’s DNA,” aligning naturally with the game’s identity. It is worth highlighting that Rematch also took the opportunity to reassure players that crossplay is still being developed and remains a central focus for the team.

While the game’s launch has brought attention and strong engagement, it hasn’t been without problems. However, the developers have moved quickly to respond. A recent Rematch patch targeted two major gameplay issues. One was the “outfield dive,” also known as the Dolphin Dive, which allowed players players bypass stamina limits. The other was a wall dribbling/climbing glitch that allowed unnatural movement across the arena. The update also included fixes for camera jitter during goal replays and added general stability improvements aimed at making the game run more smoothly.

item.title: 7 Best Open-World Games Set In The Modern Day, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Many popular open-world games are set in modern-day environments, allowing players to visit real-life-inspired places, cities, and locations.
  • Ubisoft's open-world lineup features several great modern-day titles, such as Far Cry 5 and Watch Dogs 2 .
  • Prior to Grand Theft Auto 6 , GTA 5 remains the pinnacle of modern-day open-world games, offering unmatched freedom.

Open-world games offer a huge variety of settings for players to explore. Entirely fictional worlds that combine the most unexpected elements, popular fantasy realms, grounded and realistic destinations set in the past, futuristic worlds, and everything in between — players have no shortage of options when selecting their next open-world adventure.

Some of the most popular open-world games feature modern-day settings, often including either real-life countries or cities (or something very closely inspired by them), striving to capture the aesthetic and feel of real places. With that in mind, this list aims to celebrate some of the best open-world games with contemporary settings that allow players to travel all around the world and visit some of the most iconic real-life locations.

7 Ghost Recon Wildlands

Set In Modern-Day Bolivia

Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon Wildlands
8 /10
7.7 /10
Released
March 7, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Ubisoft
Publisher(s)
Ubisoft
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Stadia
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

For players who value the scope of an open-world game the most, Ghost Recon Wildlands can be a great pick. Set in the modern-day country of Bolivia, Wildlands offers one of the biggest contemporary gaming maps for players to freely explore, coupled with a great variety of biomes and memorable locations.

Even years later, Bolivia remains stunning, captivating with its scale, impressive dynamic day-night cycle and weather system, and the sheer variety of places — such as mountains, forests, deserts, settlements, and anything in between. Given its size, Ghost Recon Wildlands also stands as one of the few open-world games where players can fly planes for much faster traversal across the game's sprawling map.

6 Sleeping Dogs

Set In Modern-Day Hong Kong

Sleeping Dogs
9 /10
10
8.3 /10
Released
August 14, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
United Front Games
Publisher(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
PS4, PS3, Xbox One, Xbox 360, PC
Powered by

One of the most underappreciated open-world titles ever, Sleeping Dogs is among the best GTA -like games, with enough distinct charm of its own. Set in contemporary Hong Kong, Sleeping Dogs utilizes its unique setting to deliver a truly bustling urban environment worth exploring, sprinkled with charismatic Asian crime bosses to face and defeat.

While there is plenty to see and do in Sleeping Dogs , the game is surprisingly focused on its relatively compact story, almost reminiscent of the Mafia series, with little to no meaningless filler, meaning it might not suit players looking for a game to sink dozens of hours into. Nevertheless, coupled with robust driving and strong combat mechanics, a gorgeous soundtrack, and visuals that have stood the test of time (especially in the Definitive Edition ), Sleeping Dogs deserves to be on any open-world fan's list who missed this title.

5 Watch Dogs 2

Set In Modern-Day San Francisco

Watch Dogs 2
8 /10
8.7 /10
Released
November 15, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Ubisoft Montreal
Publisher(s)
Ubisoft
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC, Stadia
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Established as a seemingly direct rival to the Grand Theft Auto series, the Watch Dogs franchise has been reinventing with each new entry, with Watch Dogs 2 probably standing as the most successful. While some fans might prefer the original game for its darker tone and more focused story, in terms of approach to open-world design and mission variety, the sequel is simply much more fun.

Energetic, lighthearted, and oozing with style, Watch Dogs 2 's contemporary world of San Francisco with a slightly fictionalized hacker edge is beautiful and brimming with small details, unnecessary interactions, and memorable inhabitants that make it feel lively. Even outside of missions or map activities, simply wandering the streets of the city can be a worthwhile experience.

4 Marvel's Spider-Man 2

Set In Modern-Day New York City

8 Images
8 Images
Marvel's Spider-Man 2
9 /10
48
8.9 /10

OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

As one of the most recent games, Marvel's Spider-Man 2 mostly impresses with its technical execution, delivering an expanded and gorgeously detailed map of New York City on a truly grand scale. Coupled with advanced traversal techniques and plenty of new moves and tricks for both Spider-Men, fans of the iconic Marvel superhero can spend hours mastering movement and enjoying the beautiful scenery while soaring above the sky-high buildings and bustling streets.

However, first and foremost, Marvel's Spider-Man 2 is a cinematic, story-driven adventure, with a shorter list of side activities and less of the typical open-world “filler” content — something to keep in mind when deciding whether to dive into its gorgeously rendered world.

3 Far Cry 5

Set In Modern-Day Hope County, Montana

Far Cry 5
9 /10
16
7.7 /10
Released
March 27, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Ubisoft Montreal, Ubisoft Toronto
Publisher(s)
Ubisoft
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, Stadia, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Set in the fictional Hope County somewhere in Montana, Far Cry 5 's rendition of rural USA proved a winning setting for the series, resulting in the game becoming one of the best-selling titles in Ubisoft's impressive open-world portfolio. With years of experience in the genre, the studio delivered a tight package featuring everything fans of open-world shooters might wish for: refined combat, plenty of vehicles, an intriguing map, a strong story, as well as a memorable villain and solid supporting characters.

The unique setting and characters are where the game's biggest strengths lie, bringing a much-needed breath of fresh air and touching upon more complex themes than previous entries. The success of Far Cry 5 was so significant that the game even received a direct continuation in Far Cry: New Dawn . The only gripe is the silent protagonist, who doesn't quite fit the game's narrative.

2 Like A Dragon: Infinite Wealth

Set In Modern-Day Japan & Hawaii

Like A Dragon: Infinite Wealth
9 /10
8.2 /10
Released
January 26, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Ryu Ga Gotoku Studio
Publisher(s)
Sega
Platform(s)
PS5, PS4, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Almost any game from the expansive Yakuza series could qualify as a great modern-day open-world destination, but even by the franchise's own high standards, Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth stands out. Bringing together two of the iconic protagonists, Kazuma Kiryu and Ichiban Kasuga, the game also expands its world to feature not only Yokohama, Japan, but also Honolulu, Hawaii, delivering perhaps the largest and most diverse explorable maps in the series to date.

While the essentials of the series' new direction, like turn-based combat, remain intact, Infinite Wealth also introduces dozens of new activities and mini-games, as well as a captivating story, offering hours upon hours of varied gameplay, unpredictable scenarios, and hilarious character interactions.

1 Grand Theft Auto 5

Set In Modern-Day Los Angeles-Inspired City Of Los Santos

5 Images
5 Images
Grand Theft Auto 5

Powered by

Even after almost 13 years, Grand Theft Auto 5 remains an essential open-world game set in the modern day, with only the upcoming GTA 6 potentially capable of dethroning it. Rockstar Games is truly in a league of its own when it comes to creating immersive open worlds brimming with freedom, which is why few GTA-like games in recent years can match the absorbing experience offered by GTA 5 to this day.

What sets GTA 5 apart from almost every other game on this list is that, aside from its lengthy story campaign, it also offers an expansive Online mode with a plethora of activities and rich role-play opportunities. Rockstar has supported GTA Online for years, continuously adding and expanding content and player freedom, and it's safe to say there's nothing quite like it available in gaming today.
